page.title: 12Ecology
page.content: Most of the area is intensively farmed, save for a fairly large wooded portion, part of which has been recently coppiced. The farmland com_ prises of apple orchards, recently increased, and a wide sweep of countryside with crops such as cereals, potatoes and blackcurrants. Some hedges have been replaced by willows. Wild life is prevalent. Hares are decreasing but rabbits, foxes, badgers, stoats, weasels and squirrels abound. There are numerous mice, voles, shrews etc. Bird life is abundant with partridges, pheasants, pigeons, owls, peewits, kestrels, woodpeckers and an occasional snipe. The smaller birds are numerous and are watched by inhabitants. Blackbirds, thrushes, sparrows, finches, warblers, wrens, tits, robins, yellowhammers, pied wagtails and starlings sighted.
